featured.text: John’s reckless behavior gave rise to endless trouble for his parents.
To bring the evil eye into the home is thus believed to invite trouble and sorrow.
When did the “Kawasaki” first get into trouble during the voyage? (A) Less than two days after departure from Russia.
We didn’t have the chance to talk to the man (A) or you’ll be in big trouble.

other.text: Many people who are troubled by skin rashes caused by bug bites use “foggers,” or “bug bombs,” to get rid of the annoying crawlers in their homes.
The author has been troubled by her/his weight.
The country has been troubled by a problem with trains colliding with deer on its railways.

definition.zh_def: 困擾或麻煩的情況或問題。
definition.en_def: A situation or problem that causes distress or difficulty.
definition.example: She was in trouble after forgetting to submit her assignment.
